intro: Vismia conduplicata, commonly known as the double-leaf vismia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Meliaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are often twice-pinnate, giving it its common name. It produces small, greenish-white flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Vismia conduplicata is typically found in moist, shaded habitats within tropical forests.
